title: International markets roundup
text:
Tue, Aug 4, 2015, 9:22 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets open in 38 mins. International markets roundup AAP â€“ 2 minutes 22 seconds ago Recommend Print 
A roundup of trading on major world markets: 
NEW YORK - US stocks have fallen with petroleum-linked equities retreating on a big drop in oil prices as Wall Street girds for a busy week of economic reports. 
The Dow Jones Industrial Average on Monday fell 91.66 points (0.52 per cent) to 17,598.20. 
The broad-based S&P 500 shed 5.80 (0.28 per cent) at 2,098.04, while the tech-rich Nasdaq Composite Index lost 12.90 (0.25 per cent) at 5,115.38. 
US data showed slightly weaker manufacturing activity and a modest gain in consumer spending. Investors are especially focused on Friday's jobs report for July. 
LONDON - Europe's main stock markets mostly rose, appearing to shrug off a plunge in Athens as Greek trading resumed after a five-week shutdown. 
The CAC 40 in Paris rose 0.75 per cent to 5,120.52 points, while Frankfurt's DAX 30 gained 1.19 per cent to 11,443.72 points. 
London's benchmark FTSE 100 index however slipped 0.11 per cent 6,688.62 points, with its heavyweight oil and mining sectors hit by more disappointing Chinese data, traders said. 
The euro eased to $US1.0967 from $US1.0984 late in New York on Friday. 
Greece's stock exchange re-opened with a drop of more than 22 per cent after a five-week shutdown imposed by capital controls in the country's debt crisis. 
The ATHEX index ended the day down 16.23 per cent, its biggest ever drop, to stand at 668.06 points, its worst decline in nearly 30 years. 
HONG KONG - Asian markets finished lower with China shares dragged down by poor manufacturing figures and investors followed a drop on Wall Street. 
A private survey of Chinese manufacturing activity showed a decline to a two-year low in July, suggesting the world's second largest economy faces challenges in the third quarter. 
Shanghai slipped 1.11 per cent, or 40.82 points, to end at 3,622.91, while Hong Kong shed 0.91 per cent or 224.86 points to close at 24,411.42. 
Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 index slipped 0.18 per cent, or 37.13 points, to finish at 20,548.11, while Seoul fell 21.67 points or 1.07 per cent to close at 2,008.49. 
Sydney eased 0.35 per cent, or 19.9 points, to 5,679.3 ahead of the central bank's monthly monetary policy meeting on Tuesday. 
WELLINGTON - The S&P/NZX 50 Index advanced 36.89 points, or 0.6 per cent, to 5,957.85. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
